<html><body><div><div class="article-body | article w-100"><p class="text | article-text">NORTH OLMSTED, Ohio (WOIO) - A 61-year-old man was found dead on a driveway this past weekend and a 66-year-old man was found unconscious, but alive.</p><p class="text | article-text">North Olmsted Police Detective Lieutenant Matt Beck said “this appears to be a tragic accident where alcohol was a factor and not a homicide.”</p><p class="text | article-text">According to Detective Lieutenant Beck, both men returned to Jeffrey Ropp’s home in the 26900 block of Kingston Circle Friday night.</p><p class="text | article-text">Donald Matthei, 66, slipped and fell on the driveway and lost consciousness.</p><p class="w-100"></p><p class="text | article-text">Ropp, 61, then exited the passenger’s side of Matthei’s truck and also fell.</p><p id="fusion-static-enter:EJMG6BBX5ZBJNHHAYRGBNWGIQA" data-fusion-component="EJMG6BBX5ZBJNHHAYRGBNWGIQA"></p><p id="fusion-static-exit:EJMG6BBX5ZBJNHHAYRGBNWGIQA" data-fusion-component="EJMG6BBX5ZBJNHHAYRGBNWGIQA"></p><p class="text | article-text">According to police, both men are believed to have been outside for nearly 11 hours before being found.</p><p class="text | article-text">Ropp was pronounced dead at the scene.</p><p class="text | article-text">Matthei was transported to University Hospitals St. John Medical Center.</p><p class="text | article-text">Detective Lieutenant Beck added they are still working to confirm Matthei’s statements, but “nothing discovered to this point contradicts his statements.”</p><p class="copyright |"><i>Copyright 2026 WOIO.
